content: And so, like, it's just -- look, I obviously -- in the absence of multiple expansion, right, you can look at the returns and you can say, okay, I'm buying this thing with, I don't know, 105 EBITDA, maybe that's nine -- or $9 a share free cash flow, whatever it is, you're buying this thing at nearly a 20% or whatever at 60 bucks, I guess it'll be a 15%, 16% free cash flow yield.
